SENT.plain: The epigenetic changes of tumor suppressor genes are now recognized as an alternative mechanism contributing to the development of myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS)
The expression of DNA-damage-inducible transcript 3 (DDIT3) gene has been found down-regulated in myeloid malignancies including MDS
In this study, we performed methylation-specific PCR (MSP) to investigate the methylation status of the CpG island of DDIT3 promoter region in MDS
Aberrant methylation of DDIT3 was detected in 31.8% (21/66) of the cases analyzed
No correlation was found between DDIT3 promoter methylation and clinical parameters and MDS subtypes

Although the estimated 50% survival time of the methylated DDIT3 group was shorter than that of unmethylated group (12.0 months vs. 23.0 months), the difference was not statistically significant (P=0.137)
These findings suggest that the hypermethylation of DDIT3 promoter might be one of early events in the development of MDS
